SEARCH
Package graphics

Class Intro

java.lang.Object
graphics.Intro
public class Intro extends Object
Class: Intro is the class that creates the intro page of the GUI.

    void
    createButtons(javafx.scene.layout.StackPane introLayout, javafx.scene.control.Button signButton, javafx.scene.control.Button logButton)
    Method: createButtons() creates the log and sign buttons that is displayed in the intro page of the GUI in the form of HBox.

    javafx.scene.text.Text[]
    createText()
    Method: createText() creates the text for the intro page of the GUI The text contains the title of the application, a greeting message, the operating system on which the application is running and a list of the functionalities of the application.

    setImage(String path, javafx.scene.layout.StackPane introLayout)
    Method: setImage(String, StackPane) formats the image - whale logo that is dislayed in the intro page of the GUI, next to the title "Mobi".

  • Method Details

    • createText

      public javafx.scene.text.Text[] createText()
      Method: createText() creates the text for the intro page of the GUI The text contains the title of the application, a greeting message, the operating system on which the application is running and a list of the functionalities of the application.
      Returns:
      textNodes: the array of textNodes that are created

    • formatText

      public void formatText(javafx.scene.text.Text[] textNodes, javafx.scene.layout.StackPane introLayout)
      Method: formatText(Text[], StackPane) formats the text in a modern and good-looking manner.
      Parameters:
      textNodes - : the array of textNodes to be formatted.
      introLayout - : the StackPane (introLayout) in which the textNodes will be placed.

    • format

      public void format(javafx.scene.text.Text[] textNodes, javafx.scene.layout.StackPane introLayout)
      Method: format(Text[], StackPane) formats the text in a modern and good-looking manner.
      Parameters:
      textNodes - : the array of textNodes to be formatted.
      introLayout - : the StackPane (layout) in which the textNodes will be placed.

    • setImage

      public void setImage(String path, javafx.scene.layout.StackPane introLayout)
      Method: setImage(String, StackPane) formats the image - whale logo that is dislayed in the intro page of the GUI, next to the title "Mobi".
      Parameters:
      path - : the path of the image
      introLayout - : the StackPane (layout) in which the image will be placed

    • createStartButton

      public javafx.scene.control.Button createStartButton(javafx.scene.layout.StackPane introLayout)
      Method: createStartButton(StackPane) creates the start button that is displayed in the intro page of the GUI. When pressed, it takes the user to the main page of the GUI. The action functionality takes place in the GUI class.
      Parameters:
      introLayout - : the StackPane (layout) in which the button will be placed
      Returns:
      startButton: the button that is created

    • createLogButton

      public javafx.scene.control.Button createLogButton()
      Method: createLogButton() creates the log button that is displayed in the intro page of the GUI. When pressed, it opens a window that make the user to log in. The action functionality takes place in the GUI class.
      Returns:
      logButton: the button that is created

    • createSignButton

      public javafx.scene.control.Button createSignButton()
      Method: createSignButton() creates the sign button that is displayed in the intro page of the GUI. When pressed, it opens a window that make the user to sign up. The action functionality takes place in the GUI class.
      Returns:
      signButton: the button that is created

    • createButtons

      public void createButtons(javafx.scene.layout.StackPane introLayout, javafx.scene.control.Button signButton, javafx.scene.control.Button logButton)
      Method: createButtons() creates the log and sign buttons that is displayed in the intro page of the GUI in the form of HBox.
      Parameters:
      introLayout - the StackPane (layout) in which the buttons will be placed
      signButton - The button for the sign up
      logButton - The button for the log in

    • getUserWindows

      public javafx.scene.layout.GridPane getUserWindows(String string, boolean flag)
      Method: getUserWindows() creates the GridPane that is displayed after the press of the buttons log in or sign up
      Parameters:
      string - The name of the button
      flag - The flag shows if the start button is visible or not
      Returns:
      grid The GridPane of the windows

    • createIntroScene

      public javafx.scene.Scene createIntroScene(javafx.scene.layout.StackPane introLayout)
      Method: createIntroScene(StackPane) creates the intro scene of the GUI. It is the first scene that the user sees when the application is launched.
      Parameters:
      introLayout - : the StackPane (layout) in which the scene will be placed
      Returns:
      introScene: the scene that is created
